definition: to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
clever/wonderful
variant of 妙[miao4]
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
similar/resembling/to resemble/to be like
surname Xiao/Taiwan pr. [Xiao4]

sentences.english: These two kittens on this piece of double-sided embroidery look like real ones. They are really lovable.
sentences.chinese: 这幅双面绣上的两只小猫维妙维肖，可爱极了。

sentences.english: The artist has reproduced your features very well in this portrait.
sentences.chinese: 这位艺术家在这幅画像中把你的容貌重现得维妙维肖。

sentences.english: That comedian can take off the Prime Minister perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 那个喜剧演员能把首相的样子模仿得维妙维肖。

sentences.english: She imitates animal calls and can hit off horses and dogs perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 她会学动物的叫声，能维妙维肖地模仿马嘶和狗吠。

sentences.english: James can imitate his teacher's speech perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯能维妙维肖地模仿他教师的言语。

sentences.english: He's getting good at forging his mother's signature.
sentences.chinese: 他把母亲的签名伪造得越来越维妙维肖了。

to resemble closely/to be the very image of/to look very much like/to be the spitting image of
lifelike/true to life/distinctly/clearly
